intro: Brachystegia longifolia, commonly known as the African teak, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered flowers. The tree produces woody pods that contain edible seeds, which are a valuable food source for wildlife. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in gallery forests and riverine habitats. Due to its hardy nature and economic value, it plays an important role in both ecological and local communities.
